title: Language filter permanently active
body:
I am unable to disable the in-game language filter.
I've tried re-enabling it, restarting the client and re-disabling it, it remains active.

Is there some sort of cache I can delete?
Is this a known issue?

Thanks in advance!

replies.body: Is this on the updated client?  Some settings through there may not currently be operational.  You should be able to change it through the legacy client.  Let me know if you have any questions!

Final update, I`ve tried to disable the filter in the legacy client then returning to the new one.

No dice, its still disabled.

> [{quoted}](name=Spotswood,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Her8jdME,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2016-12-08T01:58:54.913+0000)
>
> Final update, I`ve tried to disable the filter in the legacy client then returning to the new one.
> 
> No dice, its still disabled.

Change the preference file for it manually. Navigate to:
C:\\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client_releases\0.0.1.230\deploy\preferences\shared_(your summoner name)

Open the file with Notepad, edit EnableChatFilter=1 to EnableChatFilter=0, save and launch game.

Yes, this is on the new client.

I'll revert to the old client for the moment, then.

Thanks for the quick answer!
I too had this problem. Porocles' solution works, switching to Legacy client to disable language filter then switching back.

Cool.

I'll just stick with the legacy client for the moment, then.

Takes me upwards of two hours to re-download the client, hopefully they'll fix that aspect soon.
